bropals.lib.simplegame

Class GameWindow

  • java.lang.Object
    • bropals.lib.simplegame.GameWindow

  • public class GameWindow
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the drawing area.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameWindow(java.lang.String title, int screenWidth, int screenHeight)
      Creates a visible GameWindow with the supplied parameters.

      Creates a visible GameWindow with the supplied parameters.
      GameWindow(java.lang.String title, int screenWidth, int screenHeight, boolean fullscreen, java.awt.GraphicsDevice device)
      Creates a visible GameWindow with the supplied parameters.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameWindow

        public GameWindow(java.lang.String title,
          int screenWidth,
          int screenHeight,
          boolean fullscreen,
          java.awt.GraphicsDevice device)
        Creates a visible GameWindow with the supplied parameters.
        Parameters:
        title - the title of the window.
        screenWidth - the screen resolution width.
        screenHeight - the screen resolution height.
        fullscreen - the fullscreen state of the GameWindow.
        device - the GraphicsDevice to use for this GameWindow.

      • GameWindow

        public GameWindow(java.lang.String title,
          int screenWidth,
          int screenHeight,
          boolean fullscreen)
        Creates a visible GameWindow with the supplied parameters. Uses the default screen device.
        Parameters:
        title - the title of the window.
        screenWidth - the screen resolution width.
        screenHeight - the screen resolution height.
        fullscreen - the fullscreen state of the GameWindow.

      • GameWindow

        public GameWindow(java.lang.String title,
          int screenWidth,
          int screenHeight)
        Creates a visible GameWindow with the supplied parameters. Uses the default screen device; starts in windowed mode.
        Parameters:
        title - the title of the window.
        screenWidth - the screen resolution width.
        screenHeight - the screen resolution height.

    • Method Detail

      • supportsResolution

        public boolean supportsResolution(int width,
                         int height)
        Checks to see if the full screen resolution is supported. If the size does not work for fullscreen, it will still work for a window.
        Parameters:
        width - the screen width to check
        height - the screen height to check
        Returns:
        if the resolution is supported

      • supportsResolution

        public boolean supportsResolution(ScreenResolution resolution)
        Checks to see if the full screen resolution is supported. If the size does not work for fullscreen, it will still work for a window.
        Parameters:
        resolution - the screen resolution to check
        Returns:
        if the resolution is supported

      • getSupportedScreenResolutionList

        public final ScreenResolution[] getSupportedScreenResolutionList(java.awt.GraphicsDevice device)
        Makes a list of ScreenResolutions that the given graphics device supports.
        Parameters:
        device - the graphics device
        Returns:
        the list of supported screen resolutions

      • isRequestingToClose

        public boolean isRequestingToClose()
        Checks to see if the GameWindow is requesting to close.
        Returns:
        the request to close state.

      • isFullscreen

        public boolean isFullscreen()
        Checks to see if the GameWindow is in fullscreen.
        Returns:
        the fullscreen state of the window.

      • isWindowed

        public boolean isWindowed()
        Checks to see if the GameWindow is in windowed mode.
        Returns:
        the windowed state of the window.

      • setFullscreen

        public void setFullscreen(boolean fullscreen)
        Sets the fullscreen state of the GameWindow. Call applyGraphicsConfiguration() to update the fullscreen state.
        Parameters:
        fullscreen - the new fullscreen state.

      • setWindowed

        public void setWindowed(boolean windowed)
        Sets the windowed state of the GameWindow. Call applyGraphicsConfiguration() to update the windowed state.
        Parameters:
        windowed - the new windowed state.

      • setScreenResolution

        public boolean setScreenResolution(ScreenResolution screenResolution)
        Sets the screen resolution of the GameWindow. Call applyGraphicsConfiguration() to update the fullscreen state. If the screen resolution is not supported, this method returns false.
        Parameters:
        screenResolution - the new screen resolution.
        Returns:
        if the screen change was successful.

      • applyGraphicsConfiguration

        public final void applyGraphicsConfiguration()
        Has the GameWindow update its window to match the configuration it was given. The Graphics object obtained from getDrawGraphics() is now invalid, and need to have dispose() called it, replacing it with a new Graphics object.

      • getGameCursor

        public GameCursor getGameCursor()
        Gets the current game cursor. If null then the default system cursor is used.
        Returns:
        the game cursor

      • setGameCursor

        public void setGameCursor(GameCursor gameCursor)
        Sets the game cursor. If null then the default system cursor is used.
        Parameters:
        gameCursor - the game cursor

      • getDrawGraphics

        public java.awt.Graphics getDrawGraphics()
        Gets the Graphics object to draw to the screen.
        Returns:
        the graphics object to draw on the screen

      • swapBuffers

        public void swapBuffers(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Swaps the buffers. Need to pass the graphics object that was just used to draw to GameWindow.
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics that was used to draw to the GameWindow

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Destroys the window and all of its used resources.

      • getScreenWidth

        public int getScreenWidth()
        Gets the screen width in pixels.
        Returns:
        the screen width in pixels.

      • getScreenHeight

        public int getScreenHeight()
        Gets the screen height in pixels.
        Returns:
        the screen height in pixels.

      • requestToClose

        public void requestToClose()

      • getScreenResolution

        public ScreenResolution getScreenResolution()
        Gets the screen resolution.
        Returns:
        the screen resolution.

      • getMousePosition

        public java.awt.Point getMousePosition()
        Gets the mouse position in the screen's coordinate space. Returns (-1, -1) if the mouse position is not on the screen.
        Returns:
        the mouse position.

      • flushInput

        public void flushInput()
        Process all input that has occurred since the last frame.
